Let K/k be a field extension and V be a K-vector space. We call a k-subspace V_k of V a k-structure for V if the natural map K ⊗[k] V_k → V is an isomorphism. Are these defined somewhere in mathlib?

This shows up naturally in rationality questions in algebraic geometry and Galois descent. There is a wrong statement in Borel's "Linear Algebraic Groups" that I want to formalize the "correct" version of for the sake of my sanity.

I guess it would be a combination of IsBaseChange and making V_k a subspace. I'm asking if this exists already because there might be some results on Galois descent that I haven't found in the library.
@Christian Merten might be the one to ask.

We have missing API here.

I needed basic properties about kkk-structures for docs#RootPairing.restrictScalarsRat (which essentially proves that any crystallographic root system is a base change of one with coefficients in Q\mathbb{Q}Q) so I did add some results (e.g., docs#PerfectPairing.exists_basis_basis_of_span_eq_top_of_mem_algebraMap) but really some good citizen should fill out the API.

For example, formalising the following page of Bourbaki would be a useful addition to the library:
image.png

Andrew Yang said:

Christian Merten might be the one to ask.

We will (soonish) have the general descent framework (see #24434), including faithfully flat descent for modules. Probably you could use this by defining a suitable pseudofunctor from the (opposite of the) category of fields, but I don't think you gain anything and would recommend to just define this by hand.
